question:
The sequence S is defined by \(S_n = S_{n – 1} + S_{n – 2} + S_{n – 3} – 5\) for each integer n ≥ 4. If \(S_1 = 4\), \(S_2 = 0\), and \(S_4 = –4\), what is the value of \(S_6\)?
(A) –2
(B) –12
(C) –16
(D) –20
(E) –24
Show
